title: [ISSUE 504] Polish 'No route info of this topic' exception
body:
## What is the purpose of the change
[ISSUE 504](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/504).

No route info of this topic exception is a classic problem for rocketmq beginners.

If no route data of the topic is retrieved from name server, this exception will be thrown. However, in many cases, the lack of routedata in nameserver is not the real cause, such as the following situations

1. No nameserver address is set.
2. Network problems (Producer can't connect to nameserver, such as firewall).
3. Netty version issue.

The real exceptions are written to the log, and 'no route info of this topic' is thrown to console, which mislead the users. 

## Brief changelog

This PR polish exception of  'no route info of this topic'. It will throw more specific exceptions to users. For example, due to network problems, the route data fails to be obtained, and the wrapped remotingXXXXXException is directly thrown to users and users can locate the problem according to exception chaining.

## Verifying this change

title: [ISSUE #1388]Add lite pull consumer support for RocketMQ
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Work for the [issue](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/1388), add lite pull consumer support for RocketMQ

## Brief changelog

Add lite pull consumer support for RocketMQ
(1) Support consume messages in subscribe way with auto rebalance.
(2) Support consume messages in assign way with no auto rebalance support.
(3) Add seek/commit offset for a specified message queue.

title: [ISSUE #1382]Only send back part of messages by setting ackIndex
body:
## What is the purpose of the change
Set `ackIndex` by yourself when `consumeMessage` return `RECONSUME_LATER`.
#1382

## Brief changelog

XX

## Verifying this change

If `consumeMessage` pull a batch of messages and one of them throw an exception, `consumeMessage` will return `RECONSUME_LATER`. `ConsumeMessageCurrentlyService` will receive this status, and send back this batch of messages. If you want to control number of messages that should be sent back, you can set `ackIndex` property by `consumer.setAckIndex(index)`. Actually, if you still want old feature, don't use `consumer.setAckIndex()`.

title: [ISSUE #1344] Fix /dev/shm not found on some OS
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Fix issue #1344 

## Brief changelog

1. If the current OS is Darwin, create ```RAMDisk``` as the substitute for ```/dev/shm``` to store gc log. On other systems, check if  ```/dev/shm``` exists. If ```/dev/shm``` does not exist, store gc log in ```${BASE_DIR}```.

2. Correct and unify the gc log file name.

3. Use ```UseGCLogFileRotation``` in ```runserver.sh``` because name service is also a long-lived service process

modified:   distribution/benchmark/runclass.sh
modified:   distribution/bin/runbroker.sh
modified:   distribution/bin/runserver.sh

Start the name service and broker on the MacOS and Linux Systems

title: A small optimization to reduce the probability of full traversal in BlockingQueue.remove() when cleaning expired request.
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

A small optimization to reduce the probability of full traversal in BlockingQueue.remove() when cleaning expired request. 

## Brief changelog
BlockingQueue.remove() is thread-safe and occupies full lock during execution. 
When the expired cleaner try to remove a expired request which is already token by the thread pool's executor, an unnecessary full traversal occurs in BlockingQueue.remove().
In this optimization, expired cleaner trys to cancel the task with CAS before removing it from queue in order to reduce the probability of unnecessary remove option.

Set different ProducerGroup for different TraceProducer, the ProducerGroup will like `_INNER_TRACE_PRODUCER-user-specified-producer-group`

title: make DLQ msg readable and reput msgs to RetryMQ
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

1. make DLQ msg readable and can be searched like:

```
Set<MessageQueue> mqs = consumer.fetchSubscribeMessageQueues(MixAll.getDLQTopic(group));
for (MessageQueue mq : mqs) {
    PullResult pullResult = consumer.pull(mq, "*", 0, 20);
    // ...
}
```

2. send DLQ msg to retry mqs (using consumer.sendMessageBack) to consume again

## Brief changelog

1.  set DLQ topicPerm to PERM_WRITE | PERM_READ and update perm when loading DLQ topics config.

2. when consumer send msg back, set reconsumeTimes to 0 and set default delayLevel to 1 if msg's topic is DLQ topic
